newsitem.title: INDIA: Power failure hits Indian capital, two states.
newsitem.headline: Power failure hits Indian capital, two states.

text.p: A large swathe of northern India was without power on Friday after the failure of an electricity grid that supplies Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan and Delhi states, power officials said.
"The complete Delhi state has been hit by the failure," said Jagdish Kapoor, spokesman for the Delhi Electricity Supply Undertaking (DESU), which is run by Delhi civic authorities.
"Delhi, Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan are without power," he added. "We have restored power in some areas (of Delhi) and expect the work to be complete before this evening."
The Press Trust of India (PTI) reported that trains ground to halt across northern India soon after the failure occurred at 6.30 a.m. (0130 GMT).
The blackout resulted from a major fault in the electricity grid that supplies the neighbouring three states, Kapoor said.
"It is a failure in the northern grid," he said. "When there is a failure anywhere in the grid, all the states have to suffer." He had no details of the fault.
PTI quoted Delhi Chief Minister Sahib Singh Verma as saying the failure occurred because Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan had drawn more than their share of power from the grid.
It quoted Northern Railway officials as saying trains to Howrah and Bihar in the east, and Jhansi, Jaipur and Faridabad in the west had been delayed.
